instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: water damage 820-3115 with green light and NO POWER
threads.message:
Hello, I have a water damage 820-3115 that doesn't turn on. Most of the corrosion occurred on J6955 (BIL) and U3280 (t29 15v boost regulator). When I was checking the power rails I noticed that the S3 rails are missing. I also noticed that this line beeps to ground when I connect the magsafe. Is this normal? I'm assuming there is something wrong with this line rail is preventing this macbook from turning on. Can someone give me some input; not sure what else to do.

My voltages are the following:
PPBUS_G3H 12.52
PPDCIN_G3H 16.88
PP3V42_G3H 3.46
PP5V_S5 4.95
PP3V3_S5 3.29
PP5V_S3 0
PP3V3_S3 0

Thanks,

threads.title: water damage 820-3115 with green light and NO POWER
threads.message: I did more testing and im missing PM_SLP_S4_L

threads.title: water damage 820-3115 with green light and NO POWER
threads.message:
Smc_onoff_l voltage?

does pm_slp_s4_l pulse just after power applied?

threads.title: water damage 820-3115 with green light and NO POWER
threads.message:
You never measure a line besides voltage when power is applied!!

Voltage on C1802/03? Corrosion under SMC?

c1802/03  1v  there is some corrosion near the smc. I have attached a pic

Should i try to inject 5v into PP5V_s3 to see if i can get the fan to spin? I remember having a similar post

threads.title: water damage 820-3115 with green light and NO POWER
threads.message: NO! Why inject voltage.?? Look at diagram and tell me what voltage should be present on C1802/03.

threads.title: water damage 820-3115 with green light and NO POWER
threads.message: im suppose to be getting 3v. It looks like the pch creates this line. so does that mean this board is garbage? lool

They seem to be in range

r1800 290KOhms
r18010.70 MOhms

r1803 19.94 KOhms

threads.title: water damage 820-3115 with green light and NO POWER
threads.message:
Dont comment, use reply.

Why would the PCH create this signal? I see 2 pull up resistors and I can already tell you they are missing 3V on the supply side. Now you find the corroded via.
